edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.filtration

Class IncreasingLinearConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.filtration.FiltrationConverter
      • edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.filtration.IncreasingLinearConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.functional.ObjectObjectFunction<Interval<java.lang.Integer>,Interval<java.lang.Double>>

    public class IncreasingLinearConverter
extends FiltrationConverter

    This class implements a conversion between filtration values and filtration indices that is linear and increasing. If we let f_k be the filtration value at index k and N is the number of divisions, then this mapping satisfies:

    • f_k = min + k * delta
    • f_0 = min
    • f_{N-1} = max

    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

        public double computeInducedFiltrationValue(double filtrationValue1,
                                   double filtrationValue2)
        Description copied from class: FiltrationConverter
        This function computes the filtration value that is consistent with the ordering of filtration indices. For example, for filtration values that are increasing with filtration indices, this should be the max function.
